programme.title: Round Midnight
programme.desc: A jazz saxophonist (Dexter Gordon) from New York has a friend (François Cluzet) on the Left Bank of 1959 Paris.

programme.title: Under the Cherry Moon
programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.

programme.title: Black Hollywood
programme.desc: Exploring the roles of black actors, black directors and the black audience in American movies. Shot entirely on location in Hollywood in 1984.

programme.title: Jive Turkey
programme.desc: In 1950s Harlem a vicious Italian gangster (Frank deKova) tries to muscle in on a black racketeer's (Paul Harris) numbers game.

programme.title: Black Fist
programme.desc: To make money, a Los Angeles street-fighter goes to work for gangsters.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: From December. Guest host: singer Paula Abdul. Music: Doug E. Fresh. Comedy: Dwayne Kennedy, Willie Asbury.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Host Pebbles; music guests New Kids on the Block; comics John Henton and Larry Raglin.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Skyy performs, Paul Mooney provides the comedy, and Paula Abdul sings.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: David Peaston, Kevin Paige sing, comedians are Doug E. Doug and Ted Carpenter.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: The Temptations, Flame with Tony Terry, 3rd Bass perform with comedy by Ricky Harris.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Rising comics and singers are showcased.

programme.title: Something Like a Business
programme.desc: An entrepreneur (Kevin Hart) tries to take over his late uncle's escort business.

programme.title: If You Really Love Me
programme.desc: The deceased mother of three women returns to Earth as an angel to help them rediscover what is truly important in life.

programme.title: Finding Forever in Love
programme.desc: As Preach finally gets over his late girlfriend with help from a mature woman, a friend shows up carrying a dangerous secret.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Tonya sues her ex-fiancé Eric for mental anguish after she discovers he proposed with an inauthentic diamond engagement ring, causing her to end the relationship; Eric defends himself, saying he thought she loved him, not his money.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Harmony sues her neighbors for barbecuing meat in their backyard, claiming the smell of meat removed her ability to use her yard and enjoy her property, and the Lotts counter they may cook whatever they please on their own yard.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Brooke is suing her friend, Beth, for repayment of a loan.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: In Cleveland on April 26, 2007, 29-year-old Jermayne Mitchell was shot and killed near his apartment; on August 29, 2007, 67-year-old Gwen Bewley was found murdered after neighbors saw smoke coming from her house.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 2008, outdoor adventurer and sportsman Jonathan Muse is murdered on his bicycle in an underpass while riding to meet his girlfriend in Los Angeles; on September 8, 2010, Hector Urias, is murdered in his office in the late hours.

programme.title: The Long Kiss Goodnight
programme.desc: Former cohorts come after a small-town New England mom who gradually remembers her past as a government assassin.

programme.title: Why Do Fools Fall in Love
programme.desc: Three women (Halle Berry, Vivica A. Fox, Lela Rochon), all alleged widows of '50s singer Frankie Lymon, claim legal rights to his estate.
